lines.content: * The main class that runs the Chatty task management application.
* This class is responsible for initializing the user interface (UI), managing task storage,
* and interacting with the task list. It runs a loop that continuously accepts user commands,
* parses them, and executes the corresponding actions until the user decides to exit.
private TaskList taskList; // List of tasks being managed.
private Storage storage;   // Storage for loading and saving tasks.
private Ui ui;             // User interface for interacting with the user.
* Constructs a new Chatty instance, initializing the UI, storage, and task list.
* The task list is loaded from the specified CSV file.
* @param filePath The file path of the CSV file containing saved tasks.
* Starts the Chatty application by displaying the introduction message and entering the main command loop.
* The loop continues until the user exits the application.
* The main method to start the Chatty application.
* This method initializes a new Chatty instance with the path to the tasks CSV file
* and starts the application by calling the {@link #run()} method.
* @param args Command line arguments (not used in this version).
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed.
* Each command may modify the task list, interact with the user, and update storage.
* The command does not terminate the program.
* Constructs a command with the specified exit status.
* @param isExit {@code true} if the command should terminate the program, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns whether this command is an exit command.
* @return {@code true} if the command terminates the program, {@code false} otherwise.
* Executes the command with the given task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to be modified.
* @param ui      The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage to save or load data.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If the specified task is not found.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException;
* Represents a command to add a deadline to a list of tasks.
* This class is used to create a Deadline object with a description and a deadline time,
* and then add it to the TaskList. It also saves the updated list of tasks to storage
* and provides feedback to the user through the Ui component.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with a specified description and deadline.
* @param description A brief description of the deadline task.
* @param deadline The date and time when the deadline is set.
* Executes the command to add the deadline task to the task list and save it to storage.
* Provides feedback to the user on the result of the operation.
* @param tasks The TaskList where the Deadline will be added.
* @param ui The UI to communicate feedback to the user.
* @param storage The storage responsible for saving tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.sendMessage(String.format("Deadline %s added to the list\nNow you have %d tasks in the list",
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* This class allows the deletion of a task from the TaskList based on the specified index.
* It also updates the storage by saving the modified list of tasks and provides feedback
* to the user through the Ui component.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with a specified task index.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be deleted from the task list.
* Executes the command to delete the specified task from the task list and save the updated list to storage.
* Provides feedback to the user on the result of the operation.
* @param tasks The TaskList from which the task will be deleted.
* @param ui The UI to communicate feedback to the user.
* @param storage The storage responsible for saving tasks.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If the task with the given index is not found in the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {
ui.sendMessage(String.format("Task %d %s has been deleted", taskIndex, deletedTask));
* Represents a command to add a new event to the task list.
* This class is used to create an Event object with a description, start time, and end time,
* and then add it to the TaskList. It also saves the updated task list to storage and
* provides feedback to the user through the Ui component.
* Constructs an EventCommand with a specified event description, start time, and end time.
* @param eventDescription A brief description of the event.
* @param startTime The starting time of the event, represented as a String.
* @param endTime The ending time of the event, represented as a String.
public EventCommand(String eventDescription, String startTime, String endTime) {
* Executes the command to add the new event to the task list and save it to storage.
* Provides feedback to the user on the result of the operation.
* @param tasks The TaskList to which the new event will be added.
* @param ui The UI to communicate feedback to the user.
* @param storage The storage responsible for saving tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
Event newEvent = new Event(eventDescription, startTime, endTime);
ui.sendMessage(String.format("New event %s added to the list.\nNow you have %d tasks.",
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* This class is used to terminate the application by sending an exit message
* through the Ui component. It does not modify the task list or storage.
* Constructs an ExitCommand that signals the termination of the application.
* Executes the command to exit the application by sending an exit message to the user.
* @param tasks The TaskList, which is not modified in this command.
* @param ui The UI to communicate the exit message to the user.
* @param storage The storage, which is not modified in this command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command that allows the user to find tasks based on a keyword.
* The {@link FindCommand} class is responsible for searching the task list for tasks containing the specified keyword.
* If no tasks are found, a message is displayed indicating that no matching tasks were found. Otherwise, a list of
* tasks that match the keyword is shown to the user.
* Constructs a {@link FindCommand} with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in the task descriptions.
* Executes the find command to search for tasks containing the specified keyword.
* If no tasks are found with the keyword, a message is sent to the user indicating that no tasks were found.
* If tasks are found, a message is sent to the user with the number of matching tasks and their details.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to search through.
* @param ui      The user interface to communicate results to the user.
* @param storage The storage used to save or load tasks (not used in this command, but included for consistency).
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If an error occurs while searching for tasks (e.g., invalid task access).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {
ui.sendMessage("No task found with keyword " + keyword);
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.
* This class is used to retrieve all tasks from the TaskList and display them to the user.
* It converts the task list into a string representation and sends it to the user through the Ui component.
* Executes the command to display all tasks in the task list.
* The list of tasks is converted to a string and sent as a message to the user.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the tasks to be displayed.
* @param ui The UI to communicate the list of tasks to the user.
* @param storage The storage, which is not modified in this command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.sendMessage(String.format("You currently have %d tasks in the list%s", tasks.getNumOfTasks(), tasks.toString()));
* Represents a command to mark a task as completed.
* This class is used to mark a specific task in the TaskList as completed based on the provided task ID.
* It also saves the updated task list to storage and provides feedback to the user through the Ui component.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with a specified task ID to mark the corresponding task as completed.
* @param taskId The ID of the task to be marked as completed.
* Executes the command to mark the specified task as completed and save the updated task list to storage.
* Provides feedback to the user on the result of the operation.
* @param tasks The TaskList where the task will be marked as completed.
* @param ui The UI to communicate feedback to the user.
* @param storage The storage responsible for saving tasks.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If the task with the given ID is not found in the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {
ui.sendMessage(String.format("Marked chatty.task %d %s as completed", taskId, markedTask));
* Represents a command to add a new "To-Do" task to the task list.
* This class is used to create a Todo task with a description and add it to the TaskList.
* It also saves the updated task list to storage and provides feedback to the user through the Ui component.
* Constructs a TodoCommand with a specified description for the new To-Do task.
* @param description A brief description of the To-Do task to be added.
* Executes the command to add the new To-Do task to the task list and save the updated list to storage.
* Provides feedback to the user on the result of the operation.
* @param tasks The TaskList to which the new To-Do task will be added.
* @param ui The UI to communicate feedback to the user.
* @param storage The storage responsible for saving tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.sendMessage(String.format("Task %s added to list.\nYou now have %d tasks tracked",
* Represents a command to unmark a task as incomplete.
* This class is used to unmark a specific task in the TaskList as incomplete based on the provided task ID.
* It also saves the updated task list to storage and provides feedback to the user through the Ui component.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with a specified task ID to unmark the corresponding task as incomplete.
* @param taskId The ID of the task to be unmarked as incomplete.
* Executes the command to unmark the specified task as incomplete and save the updated task list to storage.
* Provides feedback to the user on the result of the operation.
* @param tasks The TaskList where the task will be unmarked as incomplete.
* @param ui The UI to communicate feedback to the user.
* @param storage The storage responsible for saving tasks.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If the task with the given ID is not found in the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {
ui.sendMessage(String.format("Marked chatty.task %d %s as incompleted", taskId, unmarkedTask));
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing user input commands and returning the corresponding Command object.
* This class processes a given string command, identifies the type of command, and constructs the appropriate Command object.
* It also validates the format of the user input and throws exceptions for invalid inputs. Supported commands include
* tasks management (such as adding, deleting, marking, and unmarking tasks), as well as event and deadline management.
* Parses the given command and returns the corresponding Command object.
* @param ui The UI used for displaying messages to the user.
* @param command The user input command string to be parsed.
* @return The appropriate Command object based on the user input.
* @throws ChattyInvalidInputException If the command format is incorrect or unsupported.
public static Command parse(Ui ui, String command) throws ChattyInvalidInputException {
throw new ChattyInvalidInputException("only one keyword is allowed");
throw new ChattyInvalidInputException("Please add an description after \"todo\" separated by a space");
throw new ChattyInvalidInputException("Please add details of an event: i.e.\"event <description> /from <start> /to <end>\"");
throw new ChattyInvalidInputException("Please follow correct event chatty.command format: i.e.\"event <description> /from <start> /to <end>\"");
throw new ChattyInvalidInputException("Please follow correct event chatty.command format: i.e.\"event <description> /from <start> /to <end>\"");
throw new ChattyInvalidInputException("Please add details of deadline, i.e.\"deadline <description> /by <dd/mm/yyyy HHmm>\"");
throw new ChattyInvalidInputException("Please input correct format of deadline chatty.command:\n\"deadline <description> /by <dd/mm/yyyy HHmm>\"");
System.out.println("Please enter a valid deadline format dd/MM/yyyy HHmm");
* The Storage class handles loading and saving tasks to/from a CSV file.
* This class is responsible for managing task persistence by interacting with a specified file for storage.
* It provides methods to load tasks from an existing CSV file or create a new task list if the file is not found,
* and to save the current task list back into the file.
* Constructs a Storage object with a specified file path for task storage.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks will be loaded from or saved to.
* Loads tasks from the specified CSV file into a TaskList object.
* If the file does not exist, a new TaskList is returned.
* Each line in the CSV file is parsed to determine the type of task (Todo, Deadline, Event),
* and appropriate task objects are created and added to the TaskList.
* @return A TaskList object containing all tasks loaded from the CSV file.
System.out.println("No existing tasks found. Creating a new local csv for storage");
* Saves the current TaskList into a CSV file.
* This method converts each task in the TaskList into its CSV representation and writes it to the specified file.
* If the parent directories of the file path do not exist, they are created.
* @param tasks The TaskList object containing the tasks to be saved.
* The Ui class handles all interactions with the user in the chatty application.
* This class provides methods to send messages to the user, display the introduction and exit messages,
* read user commands, and show help or error messages. It serves as the user interface component for the
* chatty application, ensuring the user has an interactive and informative experience.
private static final String INTRO_MSG = "Hello Master! I'm chatty.Chatty, your ever-ready personal assistant." +
private static final String EXIT_MSG = "Goodbye Master! See you soon!";
private static final String HELP_MSG = "Help is coming";
* Displays the introduction message to the user.
* This message welcomes the user to the application and offers help.
* Closes the scanner and displays the exit message.
* This method is called when the user decides to exit the application.
* Displays a message to the user.
* @param msg The message to be sent to the user.
* Reads a command entered by the user.
* @return The user's input as a string.
* Displays a help message to the user.
* This message provides instructions or general help to the user.
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param msg The error message to be displayed.
* Represents a custom exception in the chatty application.
* This exception class is used to handle general errors in the chatty application.
* It extends the {@link Exception} class and provides a custom string representation
* Returns a custom string representation of the exception.
* The default message "Oopsies!" is returned when this exception is thrown.
* @return A string representing the exception message.
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid argument is detected for a chatty command.
* This exception extends the {@link ChattyException} class and is used to indicate that an invalid argument
* was passed for a specific command in the chatty application. It provides details about the command type
* Constructs a new ChattyInvalidArgumentException with the specified command type.
* @param commandType The type of the command that caused the invalid argument error.
* Returns a detailed message describing the invalid argument error.
* The message includes the command type that caused the exception.
* @return A string message that indicates the invalid argument for the command.
return String.format(" Invalid argument detected for command: %s", commandType);
* Returns a custom string representation of the exception.
* The string representation includes the message with the command type that caused the exception.
* @return A string representing the exception message.
return String.format(" Invalid argument detected for command: %s", commandType);
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid input is detected for a chatty command.
* This exception extends the {@link ChattyException} class and is used to indicate that an invalid input
* was passed for a specific command in the chatty application. It provides details about the command that caused the error.
* Constructs a new ChattyInvalidInputException with the specified command.
* @param command The command that caused the invalid input error.
* Returns a detailed message describing the invalid input error.
* The message includes the command that caused the exception.
* @return A string message that indicates the invalid input for the command.
return String.format("I could not execute this command: %s", command);
* Returns a custom string representation of the exception.
* The string representation includes the message with the command that caused the exception.
* @return A string representing the exception message.
return String.format("I could not execute this command: %s", command);
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a task could not be found in the chatty application.
* This exception extends the {@link ChattyException} class and is used to indicate that a specific task
* could not be found based on its task ID. It provides details about the task ID that caused the error.
* Constructs a new ChattyTaskNotFoundException with the specified task ID.
* @param taskId The ID of the task that could not be found.
* Returns a detailed message describing the error when a task is not found.
* The message includes the task ID that could not be located.
* @return A string message that indicates the task could not be found.
return String.format(" Sorry! task %d could not be found", taskId);
* Returns a custom string representation of the exception.
* The string representation includes the message with the task ID that caused the exception.
* @return A string representing the exception message.
return String.format(" Sorry! task %d could not be found", taskId);
* Represents a deadline task in the chatty application.
* This class extends the {@link Task} class and includes a specific deadline time for the task.
* It provides functionality to manage and format deadline tasks, including serialization and deserialization.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with a specified name and deadline.
* @param name     The name or description of the deadline task.
* @param deadline The deadline date and time for the task.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with a specified name, completion status, and deadline.
* @param completed Indicates whether the task is completed.
* @param name      The name or description of the deadline task.
* @param deadline  The deadline date and time for the task.
public Deadline(boolean completed, String name, LocalDateTime deadline) {
* Creates a Deadline task from a CSV string representation.
* The expected CSV format is: "D,[completed status],[task name],[deadline in ISO format]".
* @param line The CSV string representing the deadline task.
* @return A new {@link Deadline} object created from the CSV data.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the CSV format is incorrect.
public static Deadline fromCsv(String line) throws IllegalArgumentException {
* Returns a CSV string representation of the deadline task.
* The format is: "D,[completed status],[task name],[deadline in ISO format]".
* @return A CSV string representing the deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* The format is: "[D] [task status] [task name] (by: [formatted deadline])".
* @return A string representing the deadline task, including its status and deadline.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HHmm");
* Represents an event task in the chatty application.
* This class extends the {@link Task} class and includes a start and end time for the event.
* It provides functionality to manage and format event tasks, including serialization and deserialization.
* Constructs a new Event task with a specified name, start time, and end time.
* @param name  The name or description of the event.
* @param start The start time of the event in string format.
* @param end   The end time of the event in string format.
public Event(String name, String start, String end) {
* Constructs a new Event task with a specified name, completion status, start time, and end time.
* @param name      The name or description of the event.
* @param completed Indicates whether the task is completed.
* @param start     The start time of the event in string format.
* @param end       The end time of the event in string format.
public Event(String name, boolean completed, String start, String end) {
* Creates an Event task from a CSV string representation.
* The expected CSV format is: "E,[completed status],[task name],[start time],[end time]".
* @param line The CSV string representing the event task.
* @return A new {@link Event} object created from the CSV data.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the CSV format is incorrect.
public static Event fromCsv(String line) throws IllegalArgumentException {
return new Event(description, isCompleted, start, end);
* Returns a CSV string representation of the event task.
* The format is: "E,[completed status],[task name],[start time],[end time]".
* @return A CSV string representing the event task.
* Returns a string representation of the event task.
* The format is: "[E] [task status] [task name] (from: [start time] to [end time])".
* @return A string representing the event task, including its status, start, and end times.
* Represents a general task in the chatty application.
* This class provides basic functionalities to track a task's name and completion status.
* It also includes methods for marking the task as done, unmarking it, and serializing the task to and from CSV format.
* Constructs a new Task with a specified name.
* The task is initially marked as not completed.
* @param taskName The name or description of the task.
* Constructs a new Task with a specified name and completion status.
* @param taskName  The name or description of the task.
* @param done      Indicates whether the task is completed.
* Gets the name or description of the task.
* Checks whether the task is completed.
* @return True if the task is completed, otherwise false.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The format is: "[X] task name" if the task is completed, or "[ ] task name" if not.
* @return A string representing the task's completion status and name.
* Checks if the task name contains the specified keyword (case-insensitive).
* This method checks if the {@link Task}'s name contains the provided keyword, ignoring case differences.
* If the keyword exists within the task name, the method returns {@code true}, otherwise {@code false}.
* @param keyWord The keyword to search for within the task name.
* @return {@code true} if the task name contains the keyword (case-insensitive), otherwise {@code false}.
* Returns a CSV string representation of the task.
* @return A CSV string representing the task.
* Creates a Task object from a CSV string representation.
* The expected CSV format is: "task name,completed status" where the completed status is either 0 (not completed) or 1 (completed).
* @param csv The CSV string representing the task.
* @return A new {@link Task} object created from the CSV data.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the CSV format is incorrect.
public static Task fromCsv(String csv) throws IllegalArgumentException {
* Represents a list of tasks in the chatty application.
* This class provides methods for managing tasks, including adding tasks, marking/unmarking tasks, deleting tasks,
* and converting the task list to a CSV format. It also provides methods for accessing and displaying the list of tasks.
* Constructs a new empty task list.

* @param numOfTasks The number of tasks in the list.
* Gets the task at the specified index in the list.
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If the task at the specified index does not exist.
public Task getTask(int index) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {
* Gets the total number of tasks in the list.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Deletes the task at the specified index.
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to delete.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If the task at the specified index does not exist.
public void delete(int index) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {
* Adds a new task to the task list.
* @return True if the task was added successfully.

* @param index The 1-based index of the task to mark as completed.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If the task at the specified index does not exist.
public void mark(int index) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {

* @param index The 1-based index of the task to unmark as completed.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If the task at the specified index does not exist.
public void unmark(int index) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {
* Converts the task list to a CSV format.
* The format will be an array of task strings, where each string represents a task in CSV format.
* @return An array of strings representing the tasks in CSV format.

* This method iterates through the task list and checks if each task's name contains the provided keyword (case-insensitive).
* If a task's name contains the keyword, it is added to a new {@link TaskList} which is then returned.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in the task names.
* @return A {@link TaskList} containing all tasks whose names contain the keyword. If no tasks match, an empty task list is returned.
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException If there are no tasks in the list or if none of the tasks contain the keyword.
public TaskList tasksContain(String keyword) throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException {

* If there are no tasks, a message indicating that no tasks are present is returned. Otherwise,
* the method returns the list of tasks, with each task being prefixed with its index in the list.
* @return A string representation of the task list.
StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(String.format("You current have %d tasks in the list", this.getNumOfTasks()));
* Represents a Todo task in the chatty application.
* This class models a task of type "Todo", which has a description and a completion status.
* It provides methods to convert a Todo task from and to CSV format, as well as to display the task in a user-friendly string format.
* Constructs a new Todo task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not completed.
* @param description The description of the Todo task.
* Constructs a new Todo task with the specified description and completion status.
* @param description The description of the Todo task.
* @param isCompleted Whether the task is completed.

* The format of the CSV string is expected to be:

*
  • Completion status (1 for completed, 0 for not completed)

* Converts the Todo task to a CSV format string.
* The format of the string is:

*
  • Completion status (1 for completed, 0 for not completed)
* @return A CSV string representing the Todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the Todo task.

*
  • Completion status (X for completed, blank for not completed)
* @return A string representing the Todo task.
* Unit test class for the {@link DeleteCommand} class.
* This test class verifies the behavior of the {@link DeleteCommand} when attempting to delete a task
* from the {@link TaskList}. It uses mocks for the {@link Ui} and {@link Storage} classes to isolate
* the logic being tested and ensure that the task is correctly removed and saved.
private TaskList tasks;    // List of tasks to be tested.
private Ui ui;             // Mocked user interface.

* Initializes a {@link TaskList}, adds a sample task, and mocks the {@link Ui} and {@link Storage}.

* when a valid task index is provided. Verifies that the task is no longer available in the {@link TaskList},
* and that the correct message is sent to the user interface and tasks are saved to storage.
* This test expects a {@link ChattyTaskNotFoundException} to be thrown when attempting to retrieve the deleted
* @throws ChattyTaskNotFoundException if the task is not found in the task list (expected in this test).

* Unit test class for the {@link Todo} class.
* This test class verifies the behavior of the {@link Todo} class, specifically the formatting of its string
* representation in different states (done or not done). It ensures that the {@link Todo#toString()} method
* returns the correct format both when the task is unmarked and marked as done.
* Tests the {@link Todo#toString()} method to ensure that it returns the correct string format for a
* {@link Todo} task that is not marked as done.
* The expected string format for a not-done task is "[T][ ] <task description>".
* Tests the {@link Todo#toString()} method to ensure that it returns the correct string format for a
* {@link Todo} task when marked as done and then unmarked as done.
* The expected string format for a done task is "[T][X] <task description>" and for an undone task,
// Mark the task as done and check the format
// Unmark the task and check the format again
deadline prep for cs2101 /by tuesday night
REM create bin directory if it doesn't exist
REM delete output from previous run
REM compile the code into the bin folder
REM run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
REM compare the output to the expected output
# create bin directory if it doesn't exist
# compile the code into the bin folder, terminates if error occurred
# run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
# compare the output to the expected output
